tip: Reading to your baby, even from birth, helps develop language skills and creates a strong bond.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Skin-to-skin contact helps regulate baby's temperature, heart rate, and stress levels.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Respond quickly to your baby's cries in the first few months - it builds trust and security, not spoiling.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Establish a consistent bedtime routine early on to help your child develop healthy sleep habits.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Talk to your baby throughout the day, narrating what you're doing - it's great for language development!
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Tummy time helps strengthen neck, shoulder, and arm muscles needed for crawling.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Limit screen time for children under 2 years - interactive play is much better for brain development.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Offer a variety of healthy foods to toddlers, and don't worry if they reject some - it can take up to 15 tries before accepting new foods.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: When your toddler has a tantrum, stay calm and acknowledge their feelings: 'I see you're upset because...'
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Create a childproof space where your little one can explore safely without constant 'no's.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Singing songs with actions helps develop memory, coordination, and language skills.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Establish a 'yes space' - an area where everything is safe to touch and explore freely.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Rotate toys instead of having them all available at once - it keeps play fresh and engaging.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Model the behavior you want to see - children learn more from what you do than what you say.
author: CribIntel Team

tip: Take care of yourself too - a rested, happy parent is better able to respond to their child's needs.
author: CribIntel Team
